welcome_message.name: Linda Kasper
welcome_message.title: Executive Director for University Housing
welcome_message.message: On behalf of all housing staff members, I welcome you to the University of Georgia! University Housing's mission is to provide comfortable, affordable and secure on-campus housing options in residential communities where students' academic success and personal growth are encouraged and supported. Your residence hall will be your home for the year, and we want to partner with you to ensure a focus on safety and belonging for all who live on campus.

mission_statement: University Housing provides comfortable, affordable and secure on-campus housing options in residential communities where the academic success and personal growth of residents are encouraged and supported.

non_discrimination_and_anti_harassment.description: The University of Georgia is committed to maintaining a fair and respectful environment for living, work, and study. The university prohibits harassment of or discrimination against any person on the basis of age, color, disability, genetic information, national origin, race, religion, sex, or veteran status.
applicable_policies: Board of Regents Policy 6.6 Non-Discrimination and Anti-Harassment
Board of Regents Policy 6.7 Sexual Misconduct Policy
USG Policy to Prohibit Discrimination & Harassment

freedom_of_expression.description: No rights are more highly regarded at the University of Georgia than the First Amendment guarantees of freedom of speech and expression and the right to assemble peaceably.

contact.office: Office of the Dean of Students

us_census_surveys.description: Residents in University Housing may be selected by the U.S. Census to participate in a variety of surveys. Some surveys are mandatory while others are voluntary.

requirements: Residents must have their UGACard at all times
Must establish a personal identification number (PIN)
Access stickers required for communities with desks
Sharing UGACards and/or PIN information is prohibited
access_control.lost_card_replacement: UGA OneCard Office in the Tate Student Center

prohibited_actions: Use or possession of alcoholic beverages except as permitted by law
Providing, distributing, selling or facilitating the use of alcoholic beverages
Disruptive or disorderly behavior related to alcohol consumption
Use or possession of narcotics or controlled substances except as permitted by law
Providing, distributing, selling or facilitating the use of controlled substances
additional_rules: Possession of alcohol containers by residents under 21 is prohibited
Common source containers prohibited in all communities
Legal age residents may consume alcohol in privacy of room/apartment only
Open containers not permitted outside individual rooms/units
No alcohol at organized functions within residential communities

permitted.specifications: Maximum 4.0 cubic ft., 118 volts, 60 Hz, not more than 1.5 amps or 180 watts

permitted.requirements: May be used only with an ironing board and should be unplugged when not in use

permitted.examples: Radios, stereos, desk lamps, computers, TVs, electric blankets

permitted.requirements: Should be plugged directly into wall
Only one extension cord per appliance, properly grounded if required

prohibited: String lights, LED strip lights, rope lights

non_combustion_engine.storage: Bicycle storage facilities, bike racks, or student rooms if not impeding egress
non_combustion_engine.prohibited_locations: Hallways, stairwells, kitchens, balconies, walkways, lobbies
non_combustion_engine.attachment: Only to approved university bicycle racks

electric_and_battery_powered.parking_restriction: Not near or against buildings or under breezeways

safety_rules: Food being prepared must not be left unattended
All appliances must be turned off before leaving kitchen
Keep combustible materials away from cooking units
Clean kitchen upon completion of use
Do not leave personal items in community kitchens

general_requirements: Alcohol containers may not be used as decorations
All electrical accessories must carry UL certification
No contact paper on university property
Painter's tape and Command strips appropriate
Tape, nails, screws, poster mounts not permitted
No holes in walls except specified buildings
No stickers on doors, furniture, glass, or university property
Decorations limited to 10% of hallway wall surface area
No decorations covering outlets, thermostats, vents, or safety devices
No decorations hanging from hallway ceilings
No blocking vision through door glass
No modifications to plumbing or electrical fixtures

seasonal_and_holiday.encouraged: Be inclusive in selecting holiday decorations
prohibited: Flammable naturally occurring items in common areas

disruptive_behavior.definition: Behavior that interferes with normal functioning or unnecessarily impedes rights of students, residents or staff
disruptive_behavior.consequences: May be charged for property damage

door_closures_and_exit_doors.propping_allowed: Only in buildings with automatic door closures for interior doors
door_closures_and_exit_doors.exterior_doors: May not be propped at any time

essential_oil_diffusers.action_if_found: Residents asked to unplug, pack, and/or remove device

all_facilities: Fire alarms linked to UGA Police

prohibited_items: Any gun (paintball, BB, potato, pellet, air soft)
Blades (straight-edge razors, razor blades, spring sticks)
Bludgeoning items (metal knucks, blackjack, bat, club)
Flailing instruments (nun chahka, nun chuck, nunchaku, shuriken, fighting chain)
firearms_weapons_and_explosives.electroshock_weapons: Prohibited against another person except in self-defense

triggers: Temporary keys not returned within 24 hours
lock_change.fee_applies: Even if lost key is later found

key_restrictions: May not be loaned to unauthorized individuals

adjustable_beds.adjustment_method: Submit work request to housing staff

lofts.unauthorized_loft: May incur administrative charge for removal

quiet_hours.definition: Noise audible one door away from source is too loud

courtesy_hours.definition: Noise should not be audible three doors away in traditional halls or outside apartment unit
courtesy_hours.applies: When quiet hours are not in effect

conditions: Only in designated locations (not during quiet hours)
musical_instruments.prohibited: Playing instruments during quiet hours even in designated locations

noise_courtesy_and_quiet_hours.community_council: May vote for more restrictive schedule

pets.permitted: Fish in aquariums of 20 gallons or less
pets.service_and_support_animals: See SERVICES FOR STUDENTS WITH DISABILITIES section

recycling_and_trash.disposal: Residents responsible for disposal in dumpsters outside building

research_in_halls.contact: Assistant to the Executive Director of University Housing

room_apartment_entry.notification: Staff will attempt to notify residents when possible
room_apartment_entry.security: Staff will lock entrance door after leaving

restrictions: Cannot move items from public areas

smoking.policy: Georgia Smoke Free Air Act of 2005
smoking.prohibited: All forms of Tobacco Products on USG Properties
smoking.reference: University System of Georgia Tobacco-free Campus policy

solicitation_and_fundraising.housing_groups: Limited to housing-sponsored fundraising organizations in designated areas
solicitation_and_fundraising.non_housing_groups: May only fundraise outside residential communities
solicitation_and_fundraising.compliance: Must comply with Engagement, Leadership and Service guidelines

requirements: Must be kept clean and free of obstructions
Screen doors at University Village must be properly shut
No trash, paper, cans, bottles, furniture in breezeways or adjacent grounds
No sweeping dirt/trash out doorways or throwing from windows
No laundry, rugs, carpet on breezeway or deck/patio railings
university_village_specific: Bicycles not in breezeways or stairwells
Toys or objects not in breezeways or stairwells
stairs_hallways_breezeways_decks_patios.removal_authority: University reserves right to remove obstructions creating unsafe/unsightly conditions

unauthorized_entry.authorization: Residents only authorized to enter assigned unit
unauthorized_entry.other_rooms: Only with permission from assigned resident
unauthorized_entry.signage: Residents and guests expected to abide by all signage

vandalism_and_damages.reporting: All incidents documented and reported to UGA Police
vandalism_and_damages.responsibility: Residents responsible for condition of rooms and furnishings

group_billing.condition: Damage above and beyond normal wear and tear in common areas

vandalism_and_damages.replacement: Residents may not replace or repair damaged items
vandalism_and_damages.billing_fee: $5 or more in damages may incur fee through Bursar
vandalism_and_damages.payment_failure: Hold placed on records preventing class registration

severe_violations.emergency_safety_equipment: Minimum $395 charge per item (e.g., exit signs)

visitation.definition: Guest is any individual who has not executed a contract for the space
visitation.priority: Roommate's rights have priority over guest's rights
visitation.roommate_agreement: Must be mutually agreed upon and can restrict (not broaden) policy

designations.schedule: Monday-Thursday 10 a.m. to 2 a.m., Friday 10 a.m. through Sunday night 2 a.m.
24 hours a day, seven days a week

visitation.modification: May be reduced by resident vote and executive director approval

conditions: Host must be resident of space
Permission required to use roommate's bed

university_village.extension_process: Email RHD at least one month in advance for up to 9 additional consecutive nights

host_responsibilities: May be found responsible for guest violations
escorting_guests: Must be escorted everywhere in building, 24 hours a day
Escort must be resident of building

student_conduct.jurisdiction: On and off campus, including residence halls

conduct_regulations.violation: Alcohol and other drug related misconduct
Theft, damage and disregard for property
Interference with orderly operation of conduct process

possible_actions: Referral to Office of Student Conduct

roommate_bill_of_rights: Right to live in a clean building and room
Right to expect roommate will respect personal belongings
Right to remedy grievances with housing staff assistance
Right to read and study without undue interference
Right to sleep without undue disturbance
Right to free access to room, furnishings and bathroom
Right to have guests during visitation hours with respect for roommate rights

contract_review_process.purpose: Determine if breach occurred and appropriate consequences
contract_review_process.independence: Independent of student conduct and law enforcement processes

process_steps.title: Receipt of information
process_steps.description: University Housing receives information/documentation regarding potential violation

process_steps.title: Review of potential violation
process_steps.description: Housing reviews information and determines if contract review necessary

process_steps.title: Notification
process_steps.description: Email sent stating alleged violation, summary of information, meeting date/time

process_steps.title: Housing contract review meeting
process_steps.description: Administrator explains process, reviews violations, resident presents information

process_steps.title: Housing contract review decision
process_steps.description: Final determination made by director of residential programs and services or designee

possible_outcomes.conditions: Violation occurred, threatens health/safety, impact is isolated, unlikely to continue if relocated
possible_outcomes.result: New assignment determined by University Housing based on availability, may include facility restrictions

possible_outcomes.conditions: Violation occurred, threatens health/safety, removal necessary for safe environment
possible_outcomes.result: Immediate removal from University Housing, housing license revoked, contract terminated

possible_outcomes.conditions: Behavior did not occur, does not constitute violation, or does not rise to threatening level
possible_outcomes.result: Remain in assigned housing, may receive warning and/or referral to conduct process

relocation_removal_details.family_impact: Spouse, domestic partner, dependents must also vacate
relocation_removal_details.fees: Remain liable for full payment, prorated for new assignment if relocated
relocation_removal_details.restrictions: May be restricted from specific halls, communities, or all facilities
relocation_removal_details.permission_required: Written permission from director required to enter restricted facilities
relocation_removal_details.trespassing: Failure to comply may result in criminal prosecution
relocation_removal_details.referral: May also be referred for disciplinary action

review_appeal.timeline: Within 24 hours of outcome letter receipt
review_appeal.method: Written request via UGA email to executive director
review_appeal.content: Specify why resident believes they were not fairly heard
review_appeal.process: Review of record only, no meeting with executive director
review_appeal.exclusions: Non-payment or pattern of late payment not reviewable

room_accommodations.registration: Must register with Accessibility and Testing
room_accommodations.communication: Coordinator communicates needs to University Housing
room_accommodations.timing: Allow adequate time before room assignment process (May 1 for fall, Dec 1 for spring)

additional_accommodations.scope: Medical reasons, navigating assignments, alternative housing options

contact.name: Kim Ellis
contact.title: Associate Director for Assignments and Contracts

service_animals.registration: Encouraged to register with Accessibility and Testing

service_animals_in_training.registration: Must register with Accessibility and Testing
service_animals_in_training.process: Associate director sends policy and agreement form

puppy_raisers.process: Associate director sends policy and agreement form
puppy_raisers.registration: Must also register with Accessibility and Testing

emotional_support_animals.registration: Must register with Accessibility and Testing for approval
emotional_support_animals.process: Associate director sends policy and ESA agreement form

abandoned_items_lost_and_found.abandoned_property: Donated or discarded when reasonable attempts to contact owner fail

air_conditioning_heating_ventilation.thermostat: In most rooms and apartment units
air_conditioning_heating_ventilation.control: Range of control in most buildings

asbestos_awareness.presence: May be present in campus buildings including residential facilities
asbestos_awareness.common_uses: Pipe insulation, spray-applied ceilings, fireproofing, plaster, wall sealant, floor tile
asbestos_awareness.safety: Asbestos in undisturbed state poses no significant health concerns
asbestos_awareness.prohibited_actions: Do not grind, hammer, screw, drill, sand, or saw into building materials or walls

cameras.access: University Housing security staff and UGA Police Department

cleaning.student_responsibility: Assigned space, private and shared bathrooms

community_televisions.service: University Cablevision all-digital on-campus cable TV
community_televisions.locations: Various lounges in each residence hall

recommendations: Bring water bottle/utensils/mugs to limit single-use plastics
Use compost bins and plastic film collection bins
Turn off lights and appliances when not in use
Never leave computers, TVs, lights on when not home
Recycle properly (green lids for recycling, black lids for landfill)
Take shorter showers (average shower uses 1 gallon per minute)

bins.black_lids: Single use coffee cups, food, foam, plastic film

health_and_safety_checks.frequency: At least once per semester and prior to break periods
health_and_safety_checks.purpose: Ensure living environments remain comfortable, safe, and clean
health_and_safety_checks.housing_action: If resident fails to address concerns
health_and_safety_checks.charges: May be charged for related costs

air_quality_tips: Avoid tossing outdoor items on bed
Use washable plain cotton or synthetic curtains
Close windows during high pollen seasons
Use damp cloth to clean surfaces
Hang damp items immediately and allow to dry completely
Do not hang damp items over furniture or closet doors
Ensure furniture does not block vents

wired.requirements: Device with Ethernet card and cable

wireless.prohibited: Personal wireless access points and routers

internet_connectivity.violations: May result in IP/MAC address block or port block, referral to Office of Student Conduct

aed.name: Automatic External Defibrillators
aed.purpose: Revive someone from sudden cardiac arrest

residence_halls.unclaimed_action: Returned to sender after 10 days (or donated/discarded if return refused)
residence_halls.address_info: Available on housing website under Explore Options
residence_halls.forwarding: First-class mail forwarded for one year after checkout

university_village_and_uv_east.usps_delivery: Central mailboxes assigned to unit number
university_village_and_uv_east.outgoing_mail: Place in provided box or drop at community office
university_village_and_uv_east.private_delivery: To resident's door seven days a week

responsibility_for_student_property.recommendation: Students or parents/guardians carry appropriate renter's insurance
responsibility_for_student_property.security_recommendation: Lock doors to reduce theft threat

on_call.weekends: 24 hours (5 p.m. Friday to 8 a.m. Monday)

staff_availability.contact_method: Call community desk to contact available staff

student_employment.information: Community offices or housing website student employment section

prevention_tips: Flush limited amounts of toilet paper at one time
Do not dispose of feminine products, paper towels, or personal wipes in toilets
If toilet does not flush properly first time, do not flush second time
Turn off water using cut-off valve under toilet if overflow occurs

tornado_warning.definition: Tornado has been sighted in immediate area
tornado_warning.action: Proceed to designated tornado shelter location immediately
tornado_warning.shelter_location: See chart at end of guide
tornado_warning.shelter_position: Areas away from windows with doors closed
tornado_warning.apartments: Bathroom or other interior locations with no windows
tornado_warning.all_clear: UGA Alert will issue all clear
tornado_warning.recommendations: Remain indoors, away from windows, on lowest floor

tornado_watch.definition: Atmospheric conditions such that tornado could develop
tornado_watch.parameters: Specific time periods and geographic areas

uga_alert.contact_methods: Up to three phone numbers and two email addresses
uga_alert.triggers: Severe threat to public safety and health of entire campus

work_requests.purpose: Routine maintenance to residence halls and apartments
work_requests.urgent_daytime: Call Work Control Office at 706-542-3999 or community desk
work_requests.charges: No charge for routine maintenance, fee for damages beyond normal wear and tear

engagement_opportunities.description: Environment for students to live and learn together
engagement_opportunities.participation: Students encouraged to participate or develop own ideas

community_councils.activities: Plan events at regularly scheduled meetings
community_councils.purpose: Implement events responding to resident needs and requests

residence_hall_association.composition: Executive board of residents and elected representative from each community council
residence_hall_association.collaboration: Works with housing staff and residents on policies, procedures, programs, facilities
residence_hall_association.goals: Foster camaraderie among residents and communities
residence_hall_association.opportunities: Travel to leadership conferences around the country

purpose: Provide recognition for individuals contributing to advancement of college/university housing
Bring service opportunities to RHA and community councils
Ensure advancement of member chapters through resource sharing, programming, leadership development
national_residence_hall_honorary.affiliation: National Association of College and University Residence Halls

duties: Supervise student staff at front desks
Provide administrative support for full-time staff
Assist residents and guests with questions/concerns

responsibilities: Manage comprehensive operations of residential areas
Respond to behavioral and developmental needs
Manage opening and closing of residence halls

residential_building_services_workers.responsibility: Clean common areas of buildings to ensure quality living environment

residential_belonging_assistants.residence: Live among students in residential communities
residential_belonging_assistants.purpose: Enhance on-campus experience by creating thriving and inclusive communities
activities: Connect students with resources promoting belonging

responsibilities: General supervision and management of assigned residence hall
graduate_residents.supervision: Some GRs supervise RAs, others support academic and leadership efforts

responsibilities: Support assistant director in day-to-day administration

resident_assistants.residence: Live among students in residential communities
responsibilities: Assist in management of student concerns
Educate residents on responsibilities as community members
Oversee leadership initiatives within residence halls

coordinator_for_residential_education_an.primary_focus: Maintaining inclusive community by promoting belonging and healthy living environments
responsibilities: Coordinate belonging efforts within University Housing
Maintain security in and around facilities
Check for propped and unsecured doors
Report suspicious behavior to UGA Police Department

services: Upkeep of building systems and infrastructure

important_phone_numbers.dialing_system: Ten-digit dialing, 706 area code required for local calls

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble in the W07 parking lot near Creswell Hall or in the parking lot near Creswell Hall directly parallel to Cloverhurst St. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Remain in the building in the interior hallways away from windows. Keep room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble in the Legion Field parking lot. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Proceed to the first-floor community hallway or bathroom, away from glass and windows while keeping room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Remain in the building away from windows, in an interior closet or bathroom. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble in the East Campus Village quad in front of Rooker Hall. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Remain in hallways away from windows, in lower floor stairwells or in an interior closet or bathroom. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble in the parking lot in front of Brown Hall and move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Remain in hallways away from windows, in lower floor stairwells or in an interior closet or bathroom. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Remain in interior hallways and community bathrooms of the building, away from glass and windows while keeping room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble near the E04/Ramsey parking deck. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Proceed to the first floor of the building and remain in the hallways, away from windows or in the lower floor stairwells. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Proceed to the first-floor community hallway or bathroom, away from glass and windows while keeping room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble in the Black-Diallo-Miller courtyard or across Linnentown Lane on the Russell Hall lawn. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Remain in interior hallways and community bathrooms of the building, away from glass and windows while keeping room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble in the Legion Field parking lot. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Proceed to the first-floor community hallway or bathroom, away from glass and windows while keeping room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Proceed to the first-floor community hallway or bathroom, away from glass and windows while keeping room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble on the front steps of Rutherford Hall. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Proceed to the first floor, away from glass and windows while keeping room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble near the E05/East parking deck. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Proceed to the first floor of the building and remain in the hallways, away from windows or in the lower floor stairwells. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble in the Legion Field parking lot. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Proceed to the first-floor community hallway or bathroom, away from glass and windows while keeping room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble on the Special Collections Library lawn. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Proceed to the first floor of the building and remain in the hallways and community bathrooms, away from windows or in the lower floor stairwells. Keep room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble at the far end of the quad closest to Soule Hall on the sidewalk nearest Lumpkin Street. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Remain in the hallways and community bathrooms, away from windows or in the lower floor stairwells. Keep room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble in the W11 lot closest to Boggs Hall. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Remain in the hallways and community bathrooms, away from windows or in the lower floor stairwells. Keep room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble on Reed Quad in front of Milledge Hall. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Proceed to the first floor of the building and remain in the hallways and community bathrooms, away from windows or in the lower floor stairwells. Keep room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble on the sidewalk farthest away from the building near Reed Quad and parallel to Hooper Street. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Proceed to the first floor of the building and remain in the hallways and community bathrooms, away from windows or in the lower floor stairwells. Keep room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Remain in the building at the lowest level possible away from windows, in an interior closet or bathroom. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble near the E05/East parking deck. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Proceed to the first floor of the building and remain in the hallways, away from windows or in the lower floor stairwells. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Remain in interior hallways and community bathrooms of the building, away from glass and windows while keeping room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble at the far end of the quad closest to Mary Lyndon Hall. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Remain in the hallways and community bathrooms, away from windows or in the lower floor stairwells. Keep room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble on Myers Quad. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Proceed to the first floor of the building and remain in the hallways and community bathrooms, away from windows or in the lower floor stairwells. Keep room doors closed. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Remain in the building at the lowest level possible away from windows, in an interior closet or bathroom. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Remain in the building at the lowest level possible away from windows, in an interior closet or bathroom. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.

fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.fire_evacuation_location: All residents must evacuate. Assemble near the E05/East parking deck. Move a minimum of 300 feet away from the building and out of the way of fire safety personnel.
fire_evacuation_and_severe_weather_shelt.severe_weather_procedure: Proceed to the first floor of the building and remain in the hallways, away from windows or in the lower floor stairwells. Follow instructions given via UGA Alert.
